snippet: Andrew Mason, the irreverent programmer and musician who turned a failed social-action site into the daily deals phenomenon Groupon, was dismissed late Thursday as chief executive, David Streitfeld reports on Friday in The New York Times. The ouster...
abstract: Andrew Mason, the irreverent programmer and musician who turned a failed social-action site into the daily deals phenomenon Groupon, was dismissed late Thursday as chief executive, David Streitfeld reports on Friday in The New York Times. The ouster came a day after Groupon reported weak fourth-quarter earnings, which caused investors to shave off a quarter of the company’s value.

headline.main: Daily Report: Groupon Dismisses Chief After a Dismal Quarter
